intro: Gamochaeta axillaris, commonly known as the slenderleaf false fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Gamochaeta axillaris is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a wetland indicator species.
